column4: if doing a dual boot with windows, EasyBCD (http://neosmart.net/EasyBCD) is your friend
so is grub2 easybcd is a okay setup but not really needed if you understand the mbr, and have the right discs.
AND you intend to use grub as your bootloader.  If, on the other hand, you really want or need to use the Windows bootloader, EasyBCD is your friend.
